thread.title: These glowing images of the Southern Lights are too beautiful for words
thread.title_full: These glowing images of the Southern Lights are too beautiful for words

author: Johnny Lieu
title: These glowing images of the Southern Lights are too beautiful for words
text:
We're sure they don't exist, but we'd like to find a person who admits to being sick of looking at the Southern Lights.
The Aurora Australis, aka Southern Lights, appeared over parts of Australia and New Zealand around Monday, making quite the spectacle for photographers and stargazers alike.
SEE ALSO: I am so unreasonably jealous of this view of the southern lights
For those who want to be right there in the sky, there's a special flight you can now take to see the aurora activity nice and close, if you got a few thousand bucks to blow.
As for the remainder of us mere mortals, we'll just have to look at photos of them. These below shots were taken on the Waitakere Ranges, just south of Auckland.
A post shared by Auckland // NZ // World (@shadowandshadenz) on Mar 27, 2017 at 4:03pm PDT
A post shared by Auckland // NZ // World (@shadowandshadenz) on Mar 27, 2017 at 4:04pm PDT
There was also cosmic activity along the southern coasts of Victoria, and in Tasmania too.
The Southern Lights are a result of charged particles from the sun slipping through Earthâ€™s magnetic field and hitting neutrally charged particles in the atmosphere.
It's an interaction that makes the particles glow in very pretty colors.
A post shared by Scott Terry (@imagesbybarefoot) on Mar 30, 2017 at 2:43am PDT
A post shared by Stefano Pribac (@stefanopribac) on Mar 29, 2017 at 2:42am PDT
A post shared by Anna Carson (@seabraephotos) on Mar 29, 2017 at 8:43pm PDT
A post shared by James Garlick (@james.garlick) on Mar 30, 2017 at 5:29pm PDT
A post shared by Rovsen Giffard (Felahoglu) (@flameoffirephotography) on Mar 28, 2017 at 2:24am PDT
A post shared by Matt LeMore (@pvddsy_) on Mar 29, 2017 at 12:03am PDT
